<<<<<<< HEAD
The lamentation
1 broadside.
s.n., [S.l. : 1688?]
In verse. Wing dates this piece 1679. It is, however, a description of the departure from England of James II, which occurred in 1688. First line reads: Come all ye tender mortals that have ears. Reproduction of original in the Huntington Library.
=======
